text: <@U13TWBRBL>  - just for reference, PEM is just base64 encoded DER with the BEGIN/END lines and specified number of characters per line  :wink:

<@U26T99AQ4> <@U0ZR63HLK> <@U1BC5A0F9> You are added as reviewers on <https://gerrit.hyperledger.org/r/#/c/3355/> but I'd call special attention to:

<https://gerrit.hyperledger.org/r/#/c/3355/2/common/policies/policy.go> Interfaces defined on lines 28 and 44
<https://gerrit.hyperledger.org/r/#/c/3355/2/orderer/multichain/manager.go> line 176

If the MSP manager provides an implementation of those interfaces on lines 28 and 44, it should be as simple as instantiating one online 176 and things should (hopefully) just work
Thanks, <@U0XPR4NP4>, will have a look soon

<@U221LL03Z> <@U0PB67X4K> that’s right, was just wondering if the code currently written in bccsp/sw/impl.go, which always assumes DER encoding, would work with a PEM byte array without the caller having to convert PEM to DER (stripping out the BEGIN/END etc.) first
